title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 February 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:14 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:15 <vmassol> has quit  
00:19 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:25 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
00:48 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
01:14 <abusenius> has quit  
01:40 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
01:44 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
02:38 <npm> has quit  
02:58 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
05:27 <sburjan`> has quit  
05:27 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
05:59 <Denis> has quit  
07:02 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rff243e0 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/ff243e0161246dcb04e809a059183ebe3228efab / (2 files in 2 dirs): XE-1115: Upgrade to HyperSQL 2.2.8 ...  
07:03 <DrLou> has quit  
07:11 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r6299144 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/commit/6299144030bfb0505367b4a16eb21c49c8a61062 / xwiki-manager-database/xwiki-manager-database-hsqldb/pom.xml : XEM-212: Upgrade to HyperSQL 2.2.8 ...  
07:44 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I'm trying to make the builds work on the agents  
08:04 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: did you fix the problem with switching editors? Is the confirmation still displayed in this case?  
08:05 <@sdumitriu> Didn't fix it yet  
08:05 <+mflorea> because I have quite a few wysiwyg tests that rely on this  
08:06 <+mflorea> anyway, I'll finish reading my mails and I'll look at Jenkins too  
08:06 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: The agents can't build because of the circular dependencies in the platform...  
08:17 <@sdumitriu> This is an old problem that didn't get fixed  
08:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi, what circular issue?  
08:17 <vmassol> (just waking up, haven't checked build yet)  
08:18 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/1512/console?  
08:18 <vmassol> the packager build  
08:18 <vmassol> ?  
08:18 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
08:19 <vmassol> ok I'll look after I've had breakfast  
08:28 <vmassol> sdumitriu: if you know what the problem is, let me know, I'm starting the investigatin  
08:29 <vmassol> for me it just says it can't find: org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-server:jar:4.0-SNAPSHOT  
08:29 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: In theory, manually building the modules in the right order on agent1 will fix the build  
08:30 <vmassol> checking why we need this dep  
08:36 <vmassol> hmm I don't get it: http://pastebin.com/X5aTZ3Wa  
08:36 <vmassol> the artifacts need to be built for mvn dependency:tree to work? hmmm  
08:37 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
08:37 <@sdumitriu> Since those aren't seen as valid modules, they're just project resources  
08:37 <vmassol> first time I see this  
08:38 <@sdumitriu> Because it's a fresh branch and the jenkins agents didn't build the platform at least once  
08:38 <@sdumitriu> (successfully)  
08:38 <vmassol> hmm stranger and stranger  
08:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <vmassol> can't find where this dep comes from: org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-server:jar:4.0-SNAPSHOT  
08:43 <vmassol> oh I know  
08:43 <vmassol> ok I get it  
08:44 <vmassol> I think I know how to solve this  
08:46 <vmassol>  we need to explicitely list all deps used in PackageMojo at runtime in the packager's pom.xml  
08:46 <vmassol> so that the packager plugin builds after those deps  
08:46 <vmassol> … hoping that these deps don't use it...  
08:46 <vmassol> if they do then the only solution will be to separate the plugin tests  
08:48 <vmassol> another solution would be to have a separate plugin for the package mojo if the other mojos are used first  
08:50 <rrodriguez> has quit  
09:07 <vmassol> ok I think I've fixed it locally… doing a full platform rebuild to be sure  
09:09 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <vmassol> has quit  
09:38 <dbaeli> has quit  
09:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
09:49 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <vmassol> has quit  
09:55 <dbaeli> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol1> mflorea: good morning, what's the release status? what's left to fix? Who's helping?  
09:57 <+mflorea> I'm currently adding Jenkins jobs for 3.5 branch. After that I'll have to fix the problem with switching editors (prevent the confirmation). Then I'll have to fix the WYSIWYG tests.  
09:59 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <vmassol1> hmm so not much was done yesterday right?  
10:00 <vmassol1> (it seems this was the state yesterday morning)  
10:00 <vmassol1> do you get enough help?  
10:00 <CIA-120> Vincent Massol master \* r080e81f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/080e81f290cb79a1b570f601be45e74ce62e776c / (8 files in 8 dirs): XWIKI-7533: Packager plugin missing explicit dependency declarations breaking the build ...  
10:01 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: you should really help fix all the issues you introduced...  
10:01 <vmassol1> you seem to don't care about functional tests which is really bad  
10:01 <vmassol1> I remind you that you still haven't fixed the EM UI tests  
10:02 <vmassol1> and the popup blocker iissue is still blocking functional tests  
10:02 <vmassol1> mflorea: maybe we should just rollback that change, it's not even halfway done  
10:03 <vmassol1> you spent several hours/days, I did the same and we still have issues with it and our solution is not even good and it introduced a regression  
10:03 <+mflorea> that would make the time we already spent fixing test useless..  
10:03 <vmassol1> no  
10:03 <vmassol1> it will still be useful for later  
10:03 <vmassol1> when it's comitted again  
10:04 <vmassol1> and sergiu is not helping at all  
10:04 <vmassol1> I'm really feeling bad about this  
10:04 <+Denis> just rollback it on the 3.5 and fix this for 4.0, no ?  
10:04 <vmassol1> yes  
10:04 <+mflorea> ok  
10:04 <vmassol1> ensure that sergiu makes the build pass before he commits this time  
10:04 <vmassol1> he's put us in trouble as often  
10:05 <vmassol1> because he doesn't care about functional tests for some reason I canot understand  
10:05 <vmassol1> I'm really sick of that TBH  
10:05 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: if you're here please respond  
10:06 <vmassol1> tell me I'm wrong and prove it!  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> OK, I was thinking about reverting that change as well  
10:07 <+mflorea> I'll finish adding jobs for 3.5 then revert it on stable-3.5.x.  
10:08 <vmassol1> mflorea: you should remove it on master too  
10:08 <vmassol1> it's breaking there too  
10:08 <+mflorea> master is 4.0, and we want to fix it there, no?  
10:09 <vmassol1> yes but we're NOT allowed to commit stuff that break  
10:09 <vmassol1> especially if we know it  
10:09 <vmassol1> that breaks everyone  
10:09 <vmassol1> sends false positive emails  
10:09 <vmassol1> is bad for the spirit  
10:09 <vmassol1> etc  
10:10 <vmassol1> the strategy is: revert, have sergiu fixes it locally and when it's working he can commit it  
10:10 <+mflorea> do we revert the changes made to ui-tests?  
10:11 <vmassol1> mflorea: we could , it's up to you since it's a little bit more work  
10:11 <vmassol1> ideally we should but it won't break if they stay AFAIK so it's your call  
10:11 <vmassol1> ofc it's not the good soltuon  
10:11 <+mflorea> ok  
10:11 <vmassol1> a better solution is to use the global var we talked about  
10:11 <vmassol1> so that'll need to be rewritten anyway  
10:12 <vmassol1> I don't think it should be recommitted before the regression with the editor swtiching is fixed too  
10:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <vmassol1> and fixing that will require that global var probably  
10:18 <+Denis> sdumitriu: no comment on my change in the internal api of HibernateBaseStore, may I commit that on 4.0 ?  
10:19 <@sdumitriu> [Proposal] Some changes I would like to introduce in the internal API of the hibernate base store ?  
10:19 <+Denis> yep  
10:20 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: can you verify that my change is corrct: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Database+Administration?viewer=changes&rev1=23.5&rev2=24.1  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> Denis: +1, I'll also reply on the list  
10:21 <+Denis> thanks  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: Yes, looks good  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: Actually I'd remove the mention of MySQL 4.x, we don't support that version since a long time ago  
10:22 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: ok, go ahead  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> Note that I didn't finish reviewing the list of indexes to create  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> Some were missing  
10:23 <+Denis> mflorea: would you mind to create version in jira so we can solve stuff on 4.0M1, thanks?  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> Denis: Already done  
10:24 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: please check my comment on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7498  
10:24 <+Denis> sorry  
10:24 <@sdumitriu> Don't you see them?  
10:24 <+Denis> miss reading  
10:24 <+Denis> forget me  
10:24 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: Right, forgot to reopen that one  
10:30 <CIA-120> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rdada637 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/dada637095f69103ff4a90ddd92d13b417f029fd / (2 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-7535: Upgrade to HyperSQL 2.2.8 ...  
10:33 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:34 <vmassol1> mflorea: has sergiu really committed the HSQLDB upgrade for 3.5?  
10:35 <vmassol1> if so I'm proposing to roll it back  
10:35 <vmassol1> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7535 says 35M1  
10:35 <+mflorea> I saw his commit after he created the 3.5 branch, so I think it's only in 4.0, let me check  
10:36 <vmassol1> the issue says 3.5M1  
10:36 <vmassol1> There are 2 issues: XEM-212, XWIKI-7535  
10:37 <vmassol1> and XE-1115  
10:38 <vmassol1> Denis, mflorea, everyone: wdyt about rolling-it back for 3.5?  
10:38 <vmassol1> there's no urgency and it's dangerous  
10:39 <vmassol1> actually we also need to verify if he's committed on master  
10:40 <vmassol1> it's on master for platform (just checked)  
10:41 <+mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commits/stable-3.5.x  
10:41 <vmassol1> doesn't seem to be on 3.5  
10:41 <+mflorea> I don't see it on 3.5  
10:41 <vmassol1> ok so it's only a jira error  
10:41 <vmassol1> fixing jira  
10:42 <vmassol1> creating jira versions  
10:42 <+Denis> was there  
10:42 <vmassol1> cool they're there  
10:44 <vmassol1> strangely XE-1115 had the right version  
10:44 <vmassol1> anyway all fixed  
10:44 <vmassol1> pfew :)  
11:13 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <jvelo> Enygma`, Hi  
11:14 <dbaeli> has quit  
11:15 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r62bab9a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/62bab9adbffffd5909060b9ede996179c62491f4 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Revert "XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user ...  
11:15 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r15e0c1d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/15e0c1d7d9f7ed95d0452676b53de743729429a6 / (2 files): XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user that there are changes he needs to save ...  
11:15 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <+Enygma`> jvelo: Hi  
11:16 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea master \* r4a9b069 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/4a9b06997c9fcd70d21a55168f1ae626e1c41529 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/EditWYSIWYGTest.java : Revert "XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user that there are changes he needs to save" ...  
11:17 <jvelo> Enygma`, quick question about XEM/Workspace manager  
11:18 <jvelo> Am I supposed to be allowed to create a workspace from the Jetty+HSQLDB distrib out of the box ?  
11:18 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r720377f https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/720377f432ce68a3781e83a895f4a5b8bd7544b8 / (2 files): XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user that there are changes he needs to save ...  
11:18 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r98e738a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/98e738ae60c7be633f02dbac1defff2839a11736 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Revert "XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user ...  
11:18 <+Enygma`> jvelo: Same as XEM. Not yet.  
11:18 <jvelo> right now when i visit WorkspaceManager.Install, it fails with : http://pastebin.com/Rd93QDg6  
11:19 <jvelo> Enygma`, OK. This is due to h2 schema initial permissions ?  
11:19 <+Enygma`> maybe with the new upgrades that have been done to HSQLDB it will be possible in the next releases  
11:19 <jvelo> I see  
11:19 <CIA-120> Marius Dumitru Florea stable-3.5.x \* r7b5fad1 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/7b5fad1dc4a1df5814584ab607276327e2b1eb65 / xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/EditWYSIWYGTest.java : Revert "XWIKI-6927: When leaving the edit mode without saving, notify the user that there are changes he needs to save" ...  
11:19 <+Enygma`> This is the old issue: XWIKI-1740  
11:19 <+Enygma`> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1740  
11:21 <jvelo> thanks  
11:21 <+Enygma`> np  
11:22 <sburjan`> has quit  
11:29 <vmassol1> jvelo: we're using hsqldb not h2...  
11:29 <vmassol1> (yet)  
11:33 <+sburjan> are we switching to h2 because of performance issues ?  
11:37 <vmassol1> no  
11:38 <vmassol1> 1) we're not switching to anything yet. It's a proposal  
11:38 <vmassol1> 2) the idea would be to get even better perf OOB  
11:42 <+sburjan> thanks vmassol1  
11:42 <jvelo> vmassol1, right  
11:50 <+mflorea> vmassol1: can you check http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/560/console ? It fails both on master and on stable-3.5.x . I tried replacing 4.0-SNAPSHOT with ${commons.version} in xwiki-rendering-standalone/dependency-reduced-pom.xml but didn't change anything. I can see org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-pom:pom:4.0-SNAPSHOT on maven http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons-pom/4.0-SNAPSHOT/ . I don't understand why it doesn't find it.  
11:50 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
11:50 <+mflorea> vmassol  
11:50 <vmassol> checking  
11:50 <vmassol> ah we looked at this with thomas yesterday  
11:51 <vmassol> and the result seemed to be a maven 3.0.4 issue  
11:51 <+mflorea> arr..  
11:51 <jvelo> has quit  
11:51 <vmassol> it failed on the agent (using maven 3.0.4) and on thomas machine (using 3.0.4)  
11:51 <vmassol> but ti works for me locally (I'm on 3.0.3)  
11:51 <vmassol> what version are you on locally?  
11:51 <+mflorea> fails locally, I have 3.0.4 too  
11:51 <vmassol> would be good to try with 3.0.3 locally for you  
11:52 <vmassol> just to confirm this  
11:52 <+mflorea> let me try it quicky, I have both  
11:54 <+mflorea> it still fails for me with 3.0.3, maybe you had build commons-pom before. Can you try to remove it from your local repo?  
11:55 <vmassol> I did that  
11:55 <vmassol> can you do that too before you rebuild with 3.0.3?  
11:55 <+mflorea> let me try  
11:55 <vmassol> I remove org/xwikii/commons dir  
11:55 <vmassol> removed  
11:55 <vmassol> when I tried yesterday  
11:56 <+mflorea> hmm, indeed it works. let me do the same with 3.0.4  
11:58 <+mflorea> it fails with 3.0.4, so indeed it looks like a maven bug  
11:58 <vmassol> thomas upgraded the maven version on jenkins yesterday to 3.0.4 ;)  
11:59 <vmassol> but it's probably possible to force it to use 3.0.3  
11:59 <+mflorea> is there any workaround we can do to make it work on 3.0.4?  
11:59 <vmassol> no idea  
11:59 <vmassol> I don't know what the problem is  
11:59 <vmassol> maybe it's been reported  
12:02 <vmassol> looking at http://jira.codehaus.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+MNG+AND+affectedVersion+%3D+%223.0.4%22  
12:05 <vmassol> seems hudson is using /home/hudsonagent/maven  
12:07 <vmassol> which is 3.0.3  
12:07 <vmassol> however thomas updated the maven plugins in jenkins and I remeber it mentioning 3.0.4  
12:08 <vmassol> it's possible this config is only used by the master and not by the agents… need to google bit  
12:10 <vmassol> ok this is what I read:  
12:10 <vmassol> "Upgrade to maven artifacts 3.0.4"  
12:10 <vmassol> from http://jenkins-ci.org/changelog  
12:11 <vmassol> we could try to roll back our version of jenkins  
12:11 <vmassol> ie downgrade to 1.449  
12:12 <vmassol> never done that, don't know what it does to plugin versions  
12:12 <vmassol> mflorea: wdyt? shoul we try to downgrade to 1.449?  
12:14 <vmassol> going for lunch, mflorea let me know if you're ok with the downgrade and we can try it when I'm back  
13:18 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
13:31 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: I've found https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MSHADE-103 . Copying the repositories section from setting.xml to xwiki-rendering-standalone pom fixes the issues. It's not nice but it's a decent workaround until MSHADE-103 gets fixed. WDYT?  
14:16 <vmassol> ah cool  
14:17 <vmassol> hmm wait  
14:17 <vmassol> I need to check if we'll be able to deploy to the central repo if we do this  
14:19 <vmassol> and I don't understand why it was working before  
14:19 <+mflorea> neither do I..  
14:20 <+mflorea> from the last comment "Oddly enough, the problem didn't happen on Jenkins even though neither of these workarounds was present."  
14:21 <vmassol> mflorea: http://ci.xwiki.org/ is stuck on ui tests, was that started before your revert?  
14:23 <+mflorea> I think so, the build started 3:20 min ago, while my commit was 3h ago (says GitHub)  
14:23 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <vmassol> ok aborting  
14:26 <+mflorea> so what do we do about xwiki-rendering-standalone? configure Jenkins to use maven 3.0.3 or add repositories to the pom?  
14:30 <vmassol> jenkins is already using 3.0.3 AFAIK  
14:30 <vmassol> (see my messages above)  
14:31 <+mflorea> note that I'm not touching the distribution management section, so I don't see how adding repos for resolving dependencies to the pom can prevent us from deploying on central  
14:31 <vmassol> "add repositories to the pom"  
14:32 <vmassol> from https://docs.sonatype.org/display/Repository/Central+Sync+Requirements  
14:33 <vmassol> "Besides, we discourage putting release repository/pluginRepository in your POM. In ideal conditions, all your dependencies should be already in central and central repository is self-contained. Otherwise people's build might break because of missing dependencies. If some of your dependencies are not in central, please upload them using our https://docs.sonatype.org/display/Repository/Uploading+3rd-party+Artifacts+to+The+Central+Reposito  
14:33 <vmassol> checking something  
14:33 <vmassol> distribution management is not an issue at all  
14:33 <vmassol> it's not used when building normally  
14:33 <vmassol> it's used only for deployments  
14:34 <vmassol> we've uploaded all xwiki commons to central  
14:34 <vmassol> and we've uploaded 3rd party jars to central  
14:34 <vmassol> just so that we don't have to specify a repository in rendernig's pom.xml  
14:35 <+mflorea> they refer only to "\_release\_ repository/pluginRepository"  
14:35 <vmassol> errr?  
14:35 <+mflorea> in this case we need the snapshot repo, which is not read from setting.xml by maven shade plugin  
14:35 <vmassol> what would like to add?  
14:35 <vmassol> maven central is only for releases  
14:36 <+mflorea> yes, so adding the snapshots repo to the pom shouldn't be a problem  
14:36 <vmassol> it will be  
14:36 <+mflorea> why?  
14:36 <vmassol> unless you remove it when you deploy  
14:37 <vmassol> it's not allowed to have any <repository> entry  
14:37 <+mflorea> I didn't understood that. I understood that you shouldn't have release repos in your pom.  
14:38 <vmassol> the shade plugin has an issue only for snapshots?  
14:39 <CIA-120> Jerome Velociter master \* rccd6697 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/ccd6697246a675e0642a64f3cf137d41c74772b5 / (2 files in 2 dirs): Correct LDAP group cache expiration comment in xwiki.cfg + set the default value to 21600 (which is 6 hours, and was probably the initial intend of the 21800 value given). - http://git.io/62wNuA

23:27 <+Denis> cjd: just trying the attachment storage on the filesystem, is that expected to have the attachment twice (one with ~v1.1) ?  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> That's versioning  
23:27 <+Denis> versioning double the attachment place even for the initial attachment  
23:27 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> The problem is that the two storages are independent  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> So we can't assume that versioining is enabled  
23:28 <+Denis> and I suppose that this is the same in the database  
23:28 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
23:28 <+Denis> I now understand why I loose some much space  
23:29 <@sdumitriu> Normally it would be possible to use just a symlink, but that would involve a different attachment store, one that knows that versioning is enabled and just uses the same files  
23:29 <+Denis> so a way is to disable versionning right ?  
23:30 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
23:30 <+Denis> what is the hints ?  
23:31 <+Denis> void  
23:31 <@sdumitriu> Yep
